english: to form a line; to queue up

etymology.description: 排(排) (pái, "line up; arrange") + 队(隊) (duì, "team; row") = to form a line; to queue up.
etymology.interpretation: 排(排) (pái, "line up; arrange") emphasizes the action of organizing or arranging, while 队(隊) (duì, "team; row") signifies a formation or sequence of people or objects. Together, they convey the concept of organizing a group of people into a line or sequence, reflecting the act of queuing.

examples.chinese: 请在入口处排队(請在入口處排隊)。
examples.english: Please queue up at the entrance.

examples.chinese: 放学后(放學後)，学生们排队买午餐(學生們排隊買午餐)。
examples.english: After school, the students form a line to buy lunch.
